text: Hi, i'm trying to create a redirect for a multilanguage blog (I've created one blog for each lang)
but no luck. anyone knows if redirect works in the blog section?

You may want to make each top-level “landing page” blog (blog-en / blog-es / blog-fr / etc.) a landing page, as I don’t think you can do a re-write (which seems to be what you’re trying to do ) on the url structure
The blog structure is what it is (at least I’m pretty sure that’s the case, open to being wrong)
for the first url in the redirect you should be doing /blog-en

hello -  i have a client question - can someone please help me if you have done this before?  thank you.  “1) validate email addresses (block invalid submissions like asdasd or  <mailto:afafaf@asd.com|afafaf@asd.com> etc) and 2) validate/lookup company addresses via the company name field”  - how do i get this functionality in a HubSpot form?  are there 3rd party integrations that can be used for this if HubSpot doesn’t natively support it.
<@U3CKY9VPY> This sounds like post-submission processing unless you want to use a validation service before “submitting” the form to the forms API
You can block “Free” address providers like gmail, but <http://asd.com|asd.com> will look valid until you match it against a service that will validate it

Maybe there’s some hidden magic going on that I don’t know about on the HubSpot backend side, but I’ve tested my forms with pure garbage emails and they’ve worked, so I assume you need to add that layer of validation in yourself

<@U4RP6AGV9> thank you. indeed, i want to use a validation service before submitting.  i would think HubSpot would provide that service natively.  but it isn’t there. so what are my options to do something like that?
also, by extension finding the company address automatically via the company name field is also a similar problem.
Try googling “email enrichment and validation” I just did and found like 6-10 SaaS providers that do this sort of validation
I’ve never integrated with a validation service before but it’s definitely possible
